title: Derivative of inverse trigonometric functions: cos(x)
text: The formula for the derivative of inverse cos(x) is $$\frac{d}{dx} {cos}^{-1} x=\frac{-1}{\sqrt{1-x^2}}$$.
speech: The formula for the derivative of inverse cos(x) is  fraction, d over, d x,  inverse cosine of x is equal to fraction, negative 1, over, the square root of 1 minus x squared end root  .

title: Applying the chain rule
text: Because the inverse of cos has a function inside its parentheses, $$\sqrt{x}$$, in this case, we need to apply the chain rule before using the formula from the previous hint. For reference, the chain rule is $$(f(g(x)))'=\operatorname{f'}\left(g{\left(x\right)}\right) \operatorname{g'}\left(x\right)$$.
